title: The New York Times is finally making changes to Wordle
description: The New York Times is making a few changes to how Wordle works, and appointing Tracy Bennett to head up the game.

title: Is the interactive horror movie making its long-overdue comeback?
description: How do you incorporate gameplay into a medium like film, which is an inherently hands-off experience? Video games may have found a compelling template.

title: Meta expected to lay off thousands in broader tech slowdown, report says
description: The Wall Street Journal reported that Meta, Facebook's parent company, plans to lay off thousands as other technology companies enact similar reductions in staff.

title: Elon Musk suspends Twitter parody accounts for ‘impersonation’
description: Accounts "engaged in impersonation" without the "parody" label will be banned, Musk said. Comedian Kathy Griffin was among those suspended from the platform.

title: Musk sees a big role for crypto on Twitter. He’ll face a tall climb.
description: Elon Musk has ambitious plans to crack down on crypto scams while promoting dogecoin.

title: Google’s Assistant is getting parental controls. Here’s how they work.
description: For the first time since its launch in 2016, Google Assistant will offer parents more control over how their children use it.

title: Trump once reconsidered sticking with Truth Social. Now he’s stuck.
description: Trump has told his allies he can’t leave his Twitter clone because he’s propping it up, and he doesn’t want a site so closely associated with his brand to collapse.
